Name: Santiago al Anochecer
Ingredients: 60 ml Light white rum (charcoal-filtered 1-4 years old)
Instructions: Select and pre-chill a Coupe glass .
Prepare garnish of grapefruit zest twist.
EXPRESS grapefruit zest twist over cocktail and use as garnish.
Review: The same colour as a red sky at night. Bittersweet, Negroni-like and a favourite with shepherds.
History: Created in 2008 by Andrew Coyle at Montpeliers Group, Edinburgh, Scotland. The name literally translates from Spanish as 'Santiago at Dusk'.
Nutrition: One serving of Santiago al Anochecer contains 212 calories
